name: Optimal reserve prices for land auctions in Eastern Germany

author.name: Marlene Kionka
author.affiliation: Faculty of Life Sciences, Department of Agricultural Economics, Humboldt-Universität zu Berlin, Berlin, Germany

author.name: Oliver Mußhoff
author.affiliation: Department of Agricultural Economics and Rural Development, Georg-August-Universität Göttingen, Göttingen, Germany

author.name: Jan-Philip Rado Uhlemann
author.affiliation: Business Economics Group, Wageningen University, Wageningen, The Netherlands

author.name: Martin Odening
author.affiliation: Faculty of Life Sciences, Department of Agricultural Economics, Humboldt-Universität zu Berlin, Berlin, Germany

publisher.name: Informa UK Limited, trading as Taylor & Francis Group
Informa UK Limited, trading as Taylor & Francis Group

abstract: Privatization auctions are seen as culprit for rising prices in eastern Germany. This study aims to analyse whether privatization auctions could have earned even higher revenues by setting optimal reserve prices. For this purpose, a structural estimation approach is applied to determine reserve prices and to compare the resulting expected revenues with actual revenues. The data set includes land auctions in eastern Germany from 2005–2019. The empirical results illustrate that room for increasing revenues exists, but reserve prices would be required to be higher than actual land prices. A potential consequence of high reserve prices is the risk of delays in the privatization process.
subject: Q15

citation: Marlene Kionka, Oliver Mußhoff, Matthias Ritter, Jan-Philip Rado Uhlemann & Martin Odening (2024) Optimal reserve prices for land auctions in Eastern Germany, Applied Economics Letters, 31:6, 574-578, DOI: 10.1080/13504851.2022.2140752

dataset.name: BVVG Land Auction Data
dataset.description: Data collected by the BVVG on arable land auctions in eastern German states from 2005–2019. Includes auction packages (lots) with information on plot size, number of plots, soil quality, date, number of bidders, and all bids.

variable_measured.name: Bid Amount
variable_measured.description: Amount bid for a lot in the auction

variable_measured.name: Number of Bidders
variable_measured.description: Number of bidders participating in the auction

variable_measured.name: Soil Quality
variable_measured.description: Quality of the soil in the plot

dataset.conditions_of_access: Data available upon request from BVVG

funding: The work was supported by the Deutsche Forschungsgemeinschaft (DFG) through Research Unit 2569 'Agricultural Land Markets – Efficiency and Regulation'.
